description.raw:
I've added a minimal example of a package that uses ignition-cmake and calls `ign_configure_build` but goes no further. This requires CMakeLists.txt files to exist in the `doc`, `include`, `src`, and `test` folders.

I also used `ExternalProject_Add` so that the examples will be built during `make`. I had to do two funky things in 08ccbf3 to allow the external project to `find_package(ignition-cmake0)` without actually installing `ignition-cmake`:

* set the `CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH` in a cmake arg to the external project
* create symlink in build folder to the `cmake` folder in the source. Since the `create_symlink` cmake command is [only supported on UNIX](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.2/manual/cmake.1.html#unix-specific-command-line-tools), ~~the ExternalProject_Add call is also restricted to UNIX systems~~ the files are copied one-by-one for non-unix systems (25f8aee)
